newsitem.title: NORWAY: Norwegian shares edge higher as buyers emerge.
newsitem.headline: Norwegian shares edge higher as buyers emerge.

text.p: Norwegian shares inched higher on Wednesday as bargain hunters emerged for some blue chips. Brokers said the positive trend was expected to remain for the rest of the week.
The Total share index edged up 2.45 points to 822.63 points, a rise of 0.3 percent. Turnover was a good 819 million crowns.
"We're still in this consolidation phase but there is growing buying interest for some of the blue chips that have recently been lagging, such as Hydro," said one broker.
Norsk Hydro, which accounted for 56 million crowns of the day's trade, climbed three crowns to 292.50 crowns.
Insurance group UNI Storebrand also attracted activity, gaining 0.60 crowns to 35 crowns.
"There was a lot of foreign interest in UNI. Many overseas investors are looking at financial shares in Norway because they are cheaply priced compared with abroad," said another dealer.

But shipping company Bergesen fell three crowns to close at 132 crowns in the A share after it forecast a mixed outlook for its businesses for the rest of the year despite a more than two-fold rise in operating profits in the first six months.
"You don't make money from just being an operator in the tanker market without asset play," said the broker.
